'''PackageKit''' is a suite of [[software application]]s designed to provide a consistent and high-level [[front end]] for a number of different [[package management system]]s. PackageKit was created by Richard Hughes.
+
'''PackageKit''' is a [[free software|free]] suite of [[software application]]s designed to provide a consistent and high-level [[front end]] for a number of different [[package management system]]s. PackageKit was created by Richard Hughes.
The suite is ostensibly [[cross-platform]], though it is primarily targeted at [[Linux distribution]]s which follow the interoperability standards set out by the [[freedesktop.org]] group. It uses the [[software libraries]] provided by the [[D-Bus]] and [[PolicyKit]] projects to handle [[inter-process communication]] and [[computer privilege]] negotiation.
The suite is ostensibly [[cross-platform]], though it is primarily targeted at [[Linux distribution]]s which follow the interoperability standards set out by the [[freedesktop.org]] group. It uses the [[software libraries]] provided by the [[D-Bus]] and [[PolicyKit]] projects to handle [[inter-process communication]] and [[computer privilege]] negotiation.

â   â
Both released under the terms of the [[GNU General Public License]], gnome-packagekit and kpackagekit are [[Free Software]].
